00040 /* Private types -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00041 typedef enum

00043   IF0_NUM = 0,
00044   IF1_NUM,
00045   IF_TOTAL_NUM
00046 } CANIF_NUMBER_Enum;

00056 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00057  * @brief  Deinitialize the specified CAN registers to their default values.
00058  * @param  CANx: where the CANx is the selected CAN from the CAN peripherals.
00059  * @retval None
00060  ************************************************************************************************************/
00061 void CAN_DeInit(HT_CAN_TypeDef* CANx)
00062 {
00063   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00064   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00065   Assert_Param(IS_CAN(CANx));
00066 
00067   if (CANx == HT_CAN0)
00068   {
00069     RSTCUReset.Bit.CAN0 = 1;
00070   }
00071 
00072   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00073 }
00074 
00075 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00076  * @brief  This function is used to set CAN to enter initialization mode and enable access bit timing
00077  *         register.After bit timing configuration ready, user must call CAN_LeaveInitMode()
00078  *         to leave initialization mode and lock bit timing register to let new configuration
00079  *         take effect.
00080  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00081  * @retval None
00082   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00083 void CAN_EnterInitMode(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
00084 {
00085   CANx->CR |= CAN_CR_INIT_Msk;
00086   CANx->CR |= CAN_CR_CCE_Msk;
00087 }
00088 
00089 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00090  * @brief  Leave initialization mode
00091  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00092  * @retval None
00093   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00094 void CAN_LeaveInitMode(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
00095 {
00096   CANx->CR &= (~(CAN_CR_INIT_Msk | CAN_CR_CCE_Msk));
00097 
00098   while(CANx->CR & CAN_CR_INIT_Msk); /* Check INIT bit is released */
00099 }
00100 
00101 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00102  * @brief  This function is used to Wait message into message buffer in basic mode. Please notice the
00103  *         function is polling NEWDAT bit of MCR register by while loop and it is used in basic mode.
00104  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00105  * @retval None
00106   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00107 void CAN_WaitMsg(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
00108 {
00109   CANx->SR = 0x0; /* clr status */
00110 
00111   while(1)
00112   {
00113     if(CANx->IF1.MCR & CAN_IF_MCR_NEWDAT_Msk)   /* check new data */
00114     {
00115       /*DEBUG_PRINTF("New Data IN\n");*/
00116       break;
00117     }
00118     if(CANx->SR & CAN_SR_RXOK_Msk)
00119     {
00120       /*DEBUG_PRINTF("Rx OK\n");*/
00121     }
00122     if(CANx->SR & CAN_SR_LEC_Msk)
00123     {
00124       /*DEBUG_PRINTF("Error\n");*/
00125     }
00126   }
00127 }
00128 
00129 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00130  * @brief  Get current bit rate
00131  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00132  * @retval Current Bit-Rate (kilo bit per second)
00133   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00134 u32 CAN_GetCANBitRate(HT_CAN_TypeDef  *CANx)
00135 {
00136   u32 wTseg1, wTseg2;
00137   u32 wBpr;
00138 
00139   wTseg1 = (CANx->BTR & CAN_BTR_TSEG0_Msk) >> CAN_BTR_TSEG0_Pos;
00140   wTseg2 = (CANx->BTR & CAN_BTR_TSEG1_Msk) >> CAN_BTR_TSEG1_Pos;
00141   wBpr  = CANx->BTR & CAN_BTR_BRP_Msk;
00142   wBpr |= CANx->BRPER << 6;
00143 
00144   return (SystemCoreClock / (wBpr + 1) / (wTseg1 + wTseg2 + 3));
00145 }
00146 
00147 /**********************************************************************************************************//**
00148  * @brief  Switch the CAN into test mode.
00149  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00150  * @param  u8TestMask Specifies the configuration in test modes
00151  *         @arg CAN_TEST_BASIC_Msk               : Enable basic mode of test mode
00152  *         @arg CAN_TEST_SILENT_Msk              : Enable silent mode of test mode
00153  *         @arg CAN_TEST_LBACK_Msk               : Enable Loop Back Mode of test mode
00154  *         @arg CAN_TEST_TX0_Msk/CAN_TEST_TX1_Msk: Control CAN_TX pin bit field
00155  * @retval None
00156   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00157 void CAN_EnterTestMode(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 u8TestMask)
00158 {
00159   CANx->CR |= CAN_CR_TEST_Msk;
00160   CANx->TR = u8TestMask;
00161 }
00162 
00163 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00164  * @brief  Leave the test mode
00165  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00166  * @retval None
00167   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00168 void CAN_LeaveTestMode(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
00169 {
00170   CANx->CR |= CAN_CR_TEST_Msk;
00171   CANx->TR &= ~(CAN_TEST_LBACK_Msk | CAN_TEST_SILENT_Msk | CAN_TEST_BASIC_Msk);
00172   CANx->CR &= (~CAN_CR_TEST_Msk);
00173 }
00174 
00175 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00176  * @brief  Get the waiting status of a received message.
00177  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00178  * @param  MsgObj: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31. 0 No message object has new data.
00179   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00180 u32 CAN_IsNewDataReceived(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj)
00181 {
00182   MsgObj--;
00183   return (MsgObj < 16 ? CANx->NDR0 & (1 << MsgObj) : CANx->NDR1 & (1 << (MsgObj - 16)));
00184 }
00185 
00186 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00187  * @brief  The function is used to Send CAN message in BASIC mode of test mode. Before call the API,
00188  *         the user should be call CAN_EnterTestMode(CAN_TEST_BASIC) and let CAN controller enter
00189  *         basic mode of test mode. Please notice IF0 Registers used as Tx Buffer in basic mode.
00190  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00191  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure containing data to transmit.
00192  * @retval TRUE:  Transmission OK, FALSE: Check busy flag of interface 0 is timeout
00193   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00194 s32 CAN_BasicSendMsg(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00195 {
00196   u32 i = 0;
00197   while(CANx->IF0.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk);
00198 
00199   CANx->SR &= (~CAN_SR_TXOK_Msk);
00200 
00201   if(pCanMsg->IdType == CAN_STD_ID)
00202   {
00203     /* standard ID*/
00204     CANx->IF0.ARB0 = 0;
00205     CANx->IF0.ARB1 = (((pCanMsg->Id) & 0x7FF) << 2) ;
00206   }
00207   else
00208   {
00209     /* extended ID*/
00210     CANx->IF0.ARB0 = (pCanMsg->Id) & 0xFFFF;
00211     CANx->IF0.ARB1 = ((pCanMsg->Id) & 0x1FFF0000) >> 16  | CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk;
00212   }
00213 
00214   if(pCanMsg->FrameType)
00215     CANx->IF0.ARB1 |= CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk;
00216   else
00217     CANx->IF0.ARB1 &= (~CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk);
00218 
00219   CANx->IF0.MCR = (CANx->IF0.MCR & (~CAN_IF_MCR_DLC_Msk)) | pCanMsg->DLC;
00220   CANx->IF0.DA0R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[1] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[0];
00221   CANx->IF0.DA1R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[3] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[2];
00222   CANx->IF0.DB0R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[5] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[4];
00223   CANx->IF0.DB1R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[7] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[6];
00224 
00225   /* request transmission*/
00226   CANx->IF0.CREQ &= (~CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk);
00227   if(CANx->IF0.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk)
00228   {
00229     return FALSE;
00230   }
00231 
00232   CANx->IF0.CREQ |= CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk; /* Sending */
00233 
00234   for(i = 0; i < 0xFFFFF; i++)
00235   {
00236     if((CANx->IF0.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk) == 0)
00237       break;
00238   }
00239 
00240   if(i >= 0xFFFFFFF)
00241   {
00242     return FALSE;
00243   }
00244   return TRUE;
00245 }
00246 
00247 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00248  * @brief  Get a message information in BASIC mode.
00249  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00250  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00251  * @retval FALSE: No any message received, TRUE: Receive a message success.
00252   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00253 s32 CAN_BasicReceiveMsg(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00254 {
00255   if((CANx->IF1.MCR & CAN_IF_MCR_NEWDAT_Msk) == 0)   /* In basic mode, receive data always save in IF1 */
00256   {
00257       return FALSE;
00258   }
00259 
00260   CANx->SR &= (~CAN_SR_RXOK_Msk);
00261 
00262   CANx->IF1.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_ARB_Msk
00263                   | CAN_IF_CMASK_CONTROL_Msk
00264                   | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAA_Msk
00265                   | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAB_Msk;
00266 
00267   if((CANx->IF1.MASK1 & CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk) == 0)
00268   {
00269     /* standard ID*/
00270     pCanMsg->IdType = CAN_STD_ID;
00271     pCanMsg->Id = (CANx->IF1.MASK1 >> 2) & 0x07FF;
00272   }
00273   else
00274   {
00275     /* extended ID*/
00276     pCanMsg->IdType = CAN_EXT_ID;
00277     pCanMsg->Id  = (CANx->IF1.ARB1 & 0x1FFF) << 16;
00278     pCanMsg->Id |= (u32)CANx->IF1.ARB0;
00279   }
00280 
00281   pCanMsg->FrameType = !((CANx->IF1.ARB1 & CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk) >> CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Pos);
00282 
00283   pCanMsg->DLC     = CANx->IF1.MCR & CAN_IF_MCR_DLC_Msk;
00284   pCanMsg->Data[0] = CANx->IF1.DA0R & CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA0_Msk;
00285   pCanMsg->Data[1] = (CANx->IF1.DA0R & CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA1_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA1_Pos;
00286   pCanMsg->Data[2] = CANx->IF1.DA1R & CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA2_Msk;
00287   pCanMsg->Data[3] = (CANx->IF1.DA1R & CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA3_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA3_Pos;
00288   pCanMsg->Data[4] = CANx->IF1.DB0R & CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA4_Msk;
00289   pCanMsg->Data[5] = (CANx->IF1.DB0R & CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA5_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA5_Pos;
00290   pCanMsg->Data[6] = CANx->IF1.DB1R & CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA6_Msk;
00291   pCanMsg->Data[7] = (CANx->IF1.DB1R & CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA7_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA7_Pos;
00292 
00293   return TRUE;
00294 }
00295 
00296 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00297  * @brief  Set Rx message object
00298  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00299  * @param  MsgObj: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00300  *         @arg CAN_STD_ID (standard ID, 11-bit)
00301  *         @arg CAN_EXT_ID (extended ID, 29-bit)
00302  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00303  * @retval TRUE: SUCCESS, FALSE: No useful interface.
00304   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00305 s32 CAN_SetRxMsgObj(HT_CAN_TypeDef  *CANx, u32 MsgObj, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00306 {
00307   u32 u8MsgIfNum = 0;
00308 
00309   if((u8MsgIfNum = GetFreeIF(CANx)) == 2)                         /* Check Free Interface for configure */
00310   {
00311       return FALSE;
00312   }
00313 
00314   if (u8MsgIfNum == 1)
00315   {
00316     /* Command Setting */
00317     CANx->IF1.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_WRRD_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_MASK_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_ARB_Msk |
00318                       CAN_IF_CMASK_CONTROL_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAA_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAB_Msk;
00319 
00320     if(pCanMsg->IdType == CAN_STD_ID)    /* According STD/EXT ID format,Configure Mask and Arbitration register */
00321     {
00322       CANx->IF1.ARB0 = 0;
00323       CANx->IF1.ARB1 = CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk | (pCanMsg->Id & 0x7FF) << 2;
00324       CANx->IF1.MASK0 = pCanMsg->MASK0;
00325       CANx->IF1.MASK1 = pCanMsg->MASK1;
00326     }
00327     else
00328     {
00329       CANx->IF1.ARB0 = pCanMsg->Id & 0xFFFF;
00330       CANx->IF1.ARB1 = CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk | CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk | (pCanMsg->Id & 0x1FFF0000) >> 16;
00331     }
00332 
00333     CANx->IF1.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_RXIE_Msk | pCanMsg->MCR ;
00334 
00335     if(pCanMsg->UMASK)
00336     {
00337       CANx->IF1.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_UMASK_Msk;
00338       CANx->IF1.MASK0 = pCanMsg->MASK0;
00339       CANx->IF1.MASK1 = pCanMsg->MASK1;
00340     }
00341 
00342     if(pCanMsg->RMTEN)
00343       CANx->IF1.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_RMTEN_Msk;
00344     else
00345       CANx->IF1.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_RMTEN_Msk);
00346 
00347     if(pCanMsg->EOB)
00348       CANx->IF1.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk;
00349     else
00350       CANx->IF1.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk);
00351 
00352     CANx->IF1.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_INTPND_Msk);
00353     CANx->IF1.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_NEWDAT_Msk);
00354     CANx->IF1.DA0R  = 0;
00355     CANx->IF1.DA1R  = 0;
00356     CANx->IF1.DB0R  = 0;
00357     CANx->IF1.DB1R  = 0;
00358     CANx->IF1.CREQ = MsgObj+1;
00359   }
00360   else
00361   {
00362     /* Command Setting */
00363     CANx->IF0.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_WRRD_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_MASK_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_ARB_Msk |
00364                       CAN_IF_CMASK_CONTROL_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAA_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAB_Msk;
00365 
00366     if(pCanMsg->IdType == CAN_STD_ID)    /* According STD/EXT ID format,Configure Mask and Arbitration register */
00367     {
00368       CANx->IF0.ARB0 = 0;
00369       CANx->IF0.ARB1 = CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk | (pCanMsg->Id & 0x7FF) << 2;
00370       CANx->IF0.MASK0 = pCanMsg->MASK0;
00371       CANx->IF0.MASK1 = pCanMsg->MASK1;
00372     }
00373     else
00374     {
00375       CANx->IF0.ARB0 = pCanMsg->Id & 0xFFFF;
00376       CANx->IF0.ARB1 = CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk | CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk | (pCanMsg->Id & 0x1FFF0000) >> 16;
00377     }
00378 
00379     CANx->IF0.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_RXIE_Msk | pCanMsg->MCR ;
00380 
00381     if(pCanMsg->UMASK)
00382     {
00383       CANx->IF0.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_UMASK_Msk;
00384       CANx->IF0.MASK0 = pCanMsg->MASK0;
00385       CANx->IF0.MASK1 = pCanMsg->MASK1;
00386     }
00387 
00388     if(pCanMsg->RMTEN)
00389       CANx->IF0.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_RMTEN_Msk;
00390     else
00391       CANx->IF0.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_RMTEN_Msk);
00392 
00393     if(pCanMsg->EOB)
00394       CANx->IF0.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk;
00395     else
00396       CANx->IF0.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk);
00397 
00398     CANx->IF0.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_INTPND_Msk);
00399     CANx->IF0.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_NEWDAT_Msk);
00400     CANx->IF0.DA0R  = 0;
00401     CANx->IF0.DA1R  = 0;
00402     CANx->IF0.DB0R  = 0;
00403     CANx->IF0.DB1R  = 0;
00404     CANx->IF0.CREQ = MsgObj+1;
00405   }
00406   return TRUE;
00407 }
00408 
00409 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00410  * @brief  Gets the message
00411  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00412  * @param  MsgObj: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00413  * @param  Release: Specifies the message release indicator.
00414  *         @arg TRUE : the message object is released when getting the data.
00415  *         @arg FALSE: the message object is not released.
00416  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00417  * @retval TRUE Success, FALSE No any message received
00418   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00419 s32 CAN_ReadMsgObj(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj, u32 Release, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00420 {
00421   u32 u8MsgIfNum = 0;
00422 
00423   if(!CAN_IsNewDataReceived(CANx, MsgObj))
00424   {
00425     return FALSE;
00426   }
00427 
00428   if((u8MsgIfNum = GetFreeIF(CANx)) == 2)                         /* Check Free Interface for configure */
00429   {
00430     return FALSE;
00431   }
00432 
00433   CANx->SR &= (~CAN_SR_RXOK_Msk);
00434 
00435   if (u8MsgIfNum == 1)
00436   {
00437   /* read the message contents*/
00438     CANx->IF1.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_MASK_Msk
00439                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_ARB_Msk
00440                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_CONTROL_Msk
00441                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_CLRINTPND_Msk
00442                     | (Release ? CAN_IF_CMASK_TXRQSTNEWDAT_Msk : 0)
00443                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAA_Msk
00444                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAB_Msk;
00445 
00446     CANx->IF1.CREQ = MsgObj;
00447 
00448     while(CANx->IF1.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk)
00449     {
00450       /*Wait*/
00451     }
00452 
00453     if((CANx->IF1.ARB1 & CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk) == 0)
00454     {
00455       /* standard ID*/
00456       pCanMsg->IdType = CAN_STD_ID;
00457       pCanMsg->Id     = (CANx->IF1.ARB1 & CAN_IF_ARB1_ID_Msk) >> 2;
00458     }
00459     else
00460     {
00461       /* extended ID*/
00462       pCanMsg->IdType = CAN_EXT_ID;
00463       pCanMsg->Id  = (CANx->IF1.ARB1 & 0x1FFF) << 16 ;
00464       pCanMsg->Id |= CANx->IF1.ARB0;
00465     }
00466     pCanMsg->MCR     = CANx->IF1.MCR;
00467     pCanMsg->DLC     = CANx->IF1.MCR & CAN_IF_MCR_DLC_Msk;
00468     pCanMsg->EOB     = CANx->IF1.MCR & CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk;
00469     pCanMsg->Data[0] = CANx->IF1.DA0R & CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA0_Msk;
00470     pCanMsg->Data[1] = (CANx->IF1.DA0R & CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA1_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA1_Pos;
00471     pCanMsg->Data[2] = CANx->IF1.DA1R & CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA2_Msk;
00472     pCanMsg->Data[3] = (CANx->IF1.DA1R & CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA3_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA3_Pos;
00473     pCanMsg->Data[4] = CANx->IF1.DB0R & CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA4_Msk;
00474     pCanMsg->Data[5] = (CANx->IF1.DB0R & CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA5_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA5_Pos;
00475     pCanMsg->Data[6] = CANx->IF1.DB1R & CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA6_Msk;
00476     pCanMsg->Data[7] = (CANx->IF1.DB1R & CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA7_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA7_Pos;
00477   }
00478   else
00479   {
00480     /* read the message contents*/
00481     CANx->IF0.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_MASK_Msk
00482                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_ARB_Msk
00483                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_CONTROL_Msk
00484                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_CLRINTPND_Msk
00485                     | (Release ? CAN_IF_CMASK_TXRQSTNEWDAT_Msk : 0)
00486                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAA_Msk
00487                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_DATAB_Msk;
00488 
00489     CANx->IF0.CREQ = MsgObj;
00490 
00491     while(CANx->IF0.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk)
00492     {
00493       /*Wait*/
00494     }
00495 
00496     if((CANx->IF0.ARB1 & CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk) == 0)
00497     {
00498       /* standard ID*/
00499       pCanMsg->IdType = CAN_STD_ID;
00500       pCanMsg->Id     = (CANx->IF0.ARB1 & CAN_IF_ARB1_ID_Msk) >> 2;
00501     }
00502     else
00503     {
00504       /* extended ID*/
00505       pCanMsg->IdType = CAN_EXT_ID;
00506       pCanMsg->Id  = (CANx->IF0.ARB1 & 0x1FFF) << 16;
00507       pCanMsg->Id |= CANx->IF0.ARB0;
00508     }
00509 
00510     pCanMsg->MCR     = CANx->IF0.MCR;
00511     pCanMsg->DLC     = CANx->IF0.MCR & CAN_IF_MCR_DLC_Msk;
00512     pCanMsg->EOB     = CANx->IF0.MCR & CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk;
00513     pCanMsg->Data[0] = CANx->IF0.DA0R & CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA0_Msk;
00514     pCanMsg->Data[1] = (CANx->IF0.DA0R & CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA1_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_A0_DATA1_Pos;
00515     pCanMsg->Data[2] = CANx->IF0.DA1R & CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA2_Msk;
00516     pCanMsg->Data[3] = (CANx->IF0.DA1R & CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA3_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_A1_DATA3_Pos;
00517     pCanMsg->Data[4] = CANx->IF0.DB0R & CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA4_Msk;
00518     pCanMsg->Data[5] = (CANx->IF0.DB0R & CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA5_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_B0_DATA5_Pos;
00519     pCanMsg->Data[6] = CANx->IF0.DB1R & CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA6_Msk;
00520     pCanMsg->Data[7] = (CANx->IF0.DB1R & CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA7_Msk) >> CAN_IF_DAT_B1_DATA7_Pos;
00521   }
00522   return TRUE;
00523 }
00524 
00525 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00526  * @brief  Set bus baud-rate.
00527  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00528  * @param  wBaudRate: The target CAN baud-rate. The range of u32BaudRate is 1~1000KHz.
00529  * @retval CurrentBitRate: Real baud-rate value.
00530   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00531 u32 CAN_SetBaudRate(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 wBaudRate)
00532 {
00533   u32 wTseg0, wTseg1;
00534   u32 wBrp;
00535   u32 wValue;
00536 
00537   CAN_EnterInitMode(CANx);
00538 
00539   SystemCoreClockUpdate();
00540 
00541   wTseg0 = 2;
00542   wTseg1 = 1;
00543 
00544   wValue = SystemCoreClock / wBaudRate;
00545 
00546   while(1)
00547   {
00548     if(((wValue % (wTseg0 + wTseg1 + 3)) == 0))
00549       break;
00550     if(wTseg1 < 7)
00551       wTseg1++;
00552 
00553     if((wValue % (wTseg0 + wTseg1 + 3)) == 0)
00554       break;
00555     if(wTseg0 < 15)
00556       wTseg0++;
00557     else
00558     {
00559       wTseg0 = 2;
00560       wTseg1 = 1;
00561       break;
00562     }
00563   }
00564 
00565   wBrp  = SystemCoreClock / (wBaudRate) / (wTseg0 + wTseg1 + 3) - 1;
00566 
00567   wValue = ((u32)wTseg1 << CAN_BTR_TSEG1_Pos) | ((u32)wTseg0 << CAN_BTR_TSEG0_Pos) |
00568             (wBrp & CAN_BTR_BRP_Msk) | (CANx->BTR & CAN_BTR_SJW_Msk);
00569   CANx->BTR = wValue;
00570   CANx->BRPER = (wBrp >> 6) & 0x0F;
00571 
00572   CAN_LeaveInitMode(CANx);
00573 
00574   return (CAN_GetCANBitRate(CANx));
00575 }
00576 
00577 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00578  * @brief  The function is used to disable all CAN interrupt.
00579  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00580  * @retval None
00581   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00582 void CAN_Close(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
00583 {
00584   CAN_DisableInt(CANx, (CAN_CR_IE_Msk | CAN_CR_SIE_Msk | CAN_CR_EIE_Msk));
00585 }
00586 
00587 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00588  * @brief  Set CAN operation mode and target baud-rate.
00589  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00590  * @param  wBaudRate The target CAN baud-rate. The range of u32BaudRate is 1~1000KHz.
00591  * @param  wMode The CAN operation mode.
00592  *         @arg  CAN_NORMAL_MODE : Normal operation.
00593  *         @arg  CAN_BASIC_MODE  : Basic operation.
00594  *         @arg  CAN_SILENT_MODE : Silent operation.
00595  *         @arg  CAN_LBACK_MODE  : Loop Back operation.
00596  *         @arg  CAN_LBS_MODE    : Loop Back combined with Silent  operation.
00597  * @retval u32CurrentBitRate Real baud-rate value.
00598   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00599 u32 CAN_Open(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 wBaudRate, u32 wMode)
00600 {
00601   u32 CurrentBitRate;
00602 
00603   CurrentBitRate = CAN_SetBaudRate(CANx, wBaudRate);
00604 
00605   if(wMode)
00606     CAN_EnterTestMode(CANx, wMode);
00607 
00608   return CurrentBitRate;
00609 }
00610 
00611 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00612  * @brief  The function is used to configure a transmit object.
00613  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00614  * @param  MsgNum: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00615  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00616  * @retval FALSE No useful interface, TRUE Config message object success.
00617   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00618 s32 CAN_SetTxMsg(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum , STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00619 {
00620   u32 MsgIfNum = 0;
00621   u32 i = 0;
00622 
00623   while((MsgIfNum = GetFreeIF(CANx)) == 2)
00624   {
00625     i++;
00626     if(i > 0x10000000)
00627     return FALSE;
00628   }
00629 
00630   /* update the contents needed for transmission*/
00631   if(MsgIfNum ==0)
00632   {
00633     CANx->IF0.CMASK = 0xF3;  /* CAN_CMASK_WRRD_Msk | CAN_CMASK_MASK_Msk | CAN_CMASK_ARB_Msk
00634                                          | CAN_CMASK_CONTROL_Msk | CAN_CMASK_DATAA_Msk  | CAN_CMASK_DATAB_Msk ; */
00635 
00636     if(pCanMsg->IdType == CAN_STD_ID)
00637     {
00638       /* standard ID*/
00639       CANx->IF0.ARB0 = 0;
00640       CANx->IF0.ARB1 = (((pCanMsg->Id) & 0x7FF) << 2) | CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk | CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk;
00641     }
00642     else
00643     {
00644       /* extended ID*/
00645       CANx->IF0.ARB0 = (pCanMsg->Id) & 0xFFFF;
00646       CANx->IF0.ARB1 = ((pCanMsg->Id) & 0x1FFF0000) >> 16 | CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk
00647                                     | CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk | CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk;
00648     }
00649 
00650     if(pCanMsg->FrameType)
00651       CANx->IF0.ARB1 |=   CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk;
00652     else
00653       CANx->IF0.ARB1 &= (~CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk);
00654 
00655     CANx->IF0.DA0R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[1] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[0];
00656     CANx->IF0.DA1R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[3] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[2];
00657     CANx->IF0.DB0R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[5] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[4];
00658     CANx->IF0.DB1R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[7] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[6];
00659     CANx->IF0.MCR = 0;
00660     if(pCanMsg->RMTEN)
00661       CANx->IF0.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_RMTEN_Msk;
00662     else
00663       CANx->IF0.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_RMTEN_Msk);
00664     if(pCanMsg->EOB)
00665       CANx->IF0.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk;
00666     else
00667       CANx->IF0.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk);
00668 
00669     CANx->IF0.MCR   |=  CAN_IF_MCR_NEWDAT_Msk | pCanMsg->DLC | CAN_IF_MCR_TXIE_Msk  ;
00670     CANx->IF0.CREQ   = MsgNum +1;
00671   }
00672   else
00673   {
00674     CANx->IF1.CMASK = 0xF3;  /* CAN_CMASK_WRRD_Msk | CAN_CMASK_MASK_Msk | CAN_CMASK_ARB_Msk
00675                                          | CAN_CMASK_CONTROL_Msk | CAN_CMASK_DATAA_Msk  | CAN_CMASK_DATAB_Msk ; */
00676 
00677     if(pCanMsg->IdType == CAN_STD_ID)
00678     {
00679       /* standard ID*/
00680       CANx->IF1.ARB0 = 0;
00681       CANx->IF1.ARB1 = (((pCanMsg->Id) & 0x7FF) << 2) | CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk | CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk;
00682     }
00683     else
00684     {
00685       /* extended ID*/
00686       CANx->IF1.ARB0 = (pCanMsg->Id) & 0xFFFF;
00687       CANx->IF1.ARB1 = ((pCanMsg->Id) & 0x1FFF0000) >> 16 | CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk
00688                                     | CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk | CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk;
00689     }
00690 
00691     if(pCanMsg->FrameType)
00692       CANx->IF1.ARB1 |=   CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk;
00693     else
00694       CANx->IF1.ARB1 &= (~CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk);
00695 
00696     CANx->IF1.DA0R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[1] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[0];
00697     CANx->IF1.DA1R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[3] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[2];
00698     CANx->IF1.DB0R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[5] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[4];
00699     CANx->IF1.DB1R = ((u16)pCanMsg->Data[7] << 8) | pCanMsg->Data[6];
00700 
00701     CANx->IF1.MCR = 0;
00702 
00703     if(pCanMsg->RMTEN)
00704       CANx->IF1.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_RMTEN_Msk;
00705     else
00706       CANx->IF1.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_RMTEN_Msk);
00707 
00708     if(pCanMsg->EOB)
00709       CANx->IF1.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk;
00710     else
00711       CANx->IF1.MCR &= (~CAN_IF_MCR_EOB_Msk);
00712 
00713     CANx->IF1.MCR   |=  CAN_IF_MCR_NEWDAT_Msk | pCanMsg->DLC | CAN_IF_MCR_TXIE_Msk  ;
00714     CANx->IF1.CREQ   = MsgNum +1;
00715   }
00716   return TRUE;
00717 }
00718 
00719 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00720  * @brief  Set transmit request bit.
00721  *         If a transmission is requested by programming bit TxRqst/NewDat (IFn_CMASK[2]), the TxRqst
00722  *         (IFn_MCON[8]) will be ignored.
00723  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00724  * @param  u32MsgNum: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00725  * @retval TRUE: Start transmit message.
00726   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00727 s32 CAN_TriggerTxMsg(HT_CAN_TypeDef  *CANx, u32 u32MsgNum)
00728 {
00729   CANx->SR &= (~CAN_SR_TXOK_Msk);
00730 
00731   /* read the message contents*/
00732   CANx->IF1.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_CLRINTPND_Msk
00733                   | CAN_IF_CMASK_TXRQSTNEWDAT_Msk;
00734 
00735   CANx->IF1.CREQ =  u32MsgNum+1;
00736 
00737   while(CANx->IF1.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk)
00738   {
00739       /*Wait*/
00740   }
00741   CANx->IF0.CMASK  = CAN_IF_CMASK_WRRD_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_TXRQSTNEWDAT_Msk;
00742   CANx->IF0.CREQ  = u32MsgNum+1;
00743 
00744   return TRUE;
00745 }
00746 
00747 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00748  * @brief  Enable CAN interrupt.
00749  *         The application software has two possibilities to follow the source of a message interrupt.
00750  *         First, it can follow the IntId in the Interrupt Register and second it can poll the Interrupt Pending Register.
00751  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00752  * @param  u32Mask: Interrupt Mask.
00753  *         @arg CAN_CR_IE_Msk : Module interrupt enable.
00754  *         @arg CAN_CR_SIE_Msk: Status change interrupt enable.
00755  *         @arg CAN_CR_EIE_Msk: Error interrupt enable.
00756  * @retval None
00757   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00758 void CAN_EnableInt(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 u32Mask)
00759 {
00760   CAN_EnterInitMode(CANx);
00761 
00762   CANx->CR = (CANx->CR & 0xF1) | ((u32Mask & CAN_CR_IE_Msk) ? CAN_CR_IE_Msk : 0)
00763               | ((u32Mask & CAN_CR_SIE_Msk) ? CAN_CR_SIE_Msk : 0)
00764               | ((u32Mask & CAN_CR_EIE_Msk) ? CAN_CR_EIE_Msk : 0);
00765 
00766 
00767   CAN_LeaveInitMode(CANx);
00768 }
00769 
00770 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00771  * @brief  Disable CAN interrupt.
00772  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00773  * @param  Mask: Interrupt Mask. (CAN_CR_IE_Msk / CAN_CR_SIE_Msk / CAN_CR_EIE_Msk).
00774  * @retval None
00775   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00776 void CAN_DisableInt(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 Mask)
00777 {
00778   CAN_EnterInitMode(CANx);
00779 
00780   CANx->CR = CANx->CR & ~(CAN_CR_IE_Msk | ((Mask & CAN_CR_SIE_Msk) ? CAN_CR_SIE_Msk : 0)
00781                             | ((Mask & CAN_CR_EIE_Msk) ? CAN_CR_EIE_Msk : 0));
00782 
00783   CAN_LeaveInitMode(CANx);
00784 }
00785 
00786 
00787 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00788  * @brief  The function is used to configure a receive message object.
00789  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00790  * @param  MsgNum: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00791  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00792  *     @arg CAN_STD_ID: The 11-bit identifier.
00793  *     @arg CAN_EXT_ID: The 29-bit identifier.
00794  * @retval FALSE No useful interface, TRUE Configure a receive message object success.
00795   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00796 s32 CAN_SetRxMsg(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum , STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00797 {
00798   u32 TimeOutCount = 0;
00799 
00800   while(CAN_SetRxMsgObj(CANx, MsgNum, pCanMsg) == FALSE)
00801   {
00802     TimeOutCount++;
00803 
00804     if(TimeOutCount >= 0x10000000) return FALSE;
00805   }
00806 
00807   return TRUE;
00808 }
00809 
00810 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00811  * @brief  The function is used to configure several receive message objects.
00812  *         The Interface Registers avoid conflict between the CPU accesses to the Message RAM and CAN message
00813  *         reception and transmission by buffering the data to be transferred.
00814  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00815  * @param  MsgNum: The starting MSG RAM number(0 ~ 31).
00816  * @param  MsgCount: the number of MSG RAM of the FIFO.
00817  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00818  *         @arg CAN_STD_ID: The 11-bit identifier.
00819  *         @arg CAN_EXT_ID: The 29-bit identifier.
00820  * @retval FALSE No useful interface, TRUE Configure receive message objects success.
00821   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00822 s32 CAN_SetMultiRxMsg(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum , u32 MsgCount, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00823 {
00824   u32 i = 0;
00825   u32 TimeOutCount;
00826 
00827   for(i = 1; i < MsgCount+1; i++)
00828   {
00829     TimeOutCount = 0;
00830     pCanMsg->EOB = 0;
00831 
00832     if(i == MsgCount)
00833       pCanMsg->EOB=1;
00834 
00835     while(CAN_SetRxMsgObj(CANx, MsgNum, pCanMsg) == FALSE)
00836     {
00837       TimeOutCount++;
00838 
00839       if(TimeOutCount >= 0x10000000)
00840         return FALSE;
00841     }
00842     MsgNum ++;
00843   }
00844 
00845   return TRUE;
00846 }
00847 
00848 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00849  * @brief  Send CAN message.
00850  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00851  * @param  MsgNum: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00852  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00853  * @retval FALSE: 1. When operation in basic mode: Transmit message time out.
00854  *                2. When operation in normal mode: No useful interface.
00855  *         TRUE: Transmit Message success.
00856   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00857 s32 CAN_Transmit(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum , STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00858 {
00859   if((CANx->CR & CAN_CR_TEST_Msk) && (CANx->TR & CAN_TEST_BASIC_Msk))
00860   {
00861     return (CAN_BasicSendMsg(CANx, pCanMsg));
00862   }
00863   else
00864   {
00865     if(CAN_SetTxMsg(CANx, MsgNum, pCanMsg) == FALSE)
00866         return FALSE;
00867 
00868     CANx->SR &= (~CAN_SR_TXOK_Msk);
00869 
00870     /* read the message contents*/
00871     CANx->IF1.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_CLRINTPND_Msk
00872                     | CAN_IF_CMASK_TXRQSTNEWDAT_Msk;
00873 
00874     CANx->IF1.CREQ =  MsgNum+1;
00875 
00876     while(CANx->IF1.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk)
00877     {
00878       /*Wait*/
00879     }
00880     CANx->IF0.CMASK  = CAN_IF_CMASK_WRRD_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_TXRQSTNEWDAT_Msk;
00881     CANx->IF0.CREQ   = MsgNum+1;
00882   }
00883 
00884   return TRUE;
00885 }
00886 
00887 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00888  * @brief  Gets the message, if received.
00889  *         The Interface Registers avoid conflict between the CPU accesses to the Message RAM and CAN message
00890  *         reception and transmission by buffering the data to be transferred.
00891  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00892  * @param  MsgNum: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00893  * @param  pCanMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00894  * @retval FALSE: No any message received, TRUE: Receive Message success.
00895   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00896 s32 CAN_Receive(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum , STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef* pCanMsg)
00897 {
00898   if((CANx->CR & CAN_CR_TEST_Msk) && (CANx->TR & CAN_TEST_BASIC_Msk))
00899   {
00900     return (CAN_BasicReceiveMsg(CANx, pCanMsg));
00901   }
00902   else
00903   {
00904     return CAN_ReadMsgObj(CANx, MsgNum, TRUE, pCanMsg);
00905   }
00906 }
00907 
00908 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00909  * @brief  Clear interrupt pending bit.
00910  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00911  * @param  MsgNum: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00912  * @retval None
00913   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00914 void CAN_CLR_INT_PENDING_BIT(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum)
00915 {
00916   u32 u32IFBusyCount = 0;
00917 
00918   while(u32IFBusyCount < 0x10000000)
00919   {
00920     if((CANx->IF0.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk) == 0)
00921     {
00922       CANx->IF0.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_CLRINTPND_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_TXRQSTNEWDAT_Msk;
00923       CANx->IF0.CREQ = MsgNum+1;
00924       break;
00925     }
00926     else if((CANx->IF1.CREQ  & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk) == 0)
00927     {
00928       CANx->IF1.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_CLRINTPND_Msk | CAN_IF_CMASK_TXRQSTNEWDAT_Msk;
00929       CANx->IF1.CREQ = MsgNum+1;
00930       break;
00931     }
00932 
00933     u32IFBusyCount++;
00934   }
00935 }
00936 
00937 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00938  * @brief  The function is used to configure Mask as the message object.
00939  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
00940  * @param  MsgObj: Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
00941  * @param  MaskMsg: Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
00942  *         @arg CAN_STD_ID: The 11-bit identifier.
00943  *         @arg CAN_EXT_ID: The 29-bit identifier.
00944  * @retval FALSE No useful interface, TRUE Configure a receive message object success.
00945   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00946 s32 CAN_MsgObjMaskConfig(HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef* MaskMsg)
00947 {
00948   if(MaskMsg->IdType == CAN_STD_ID)
00949   {
00950     /* standard ID*/
00951     CANx->IF0.ARB0 = 0;
00952     CANx->IF0.ARB1 = (((MaskMsg->Id) & 0x7FF) << 2)  | CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk ;
00953 
00954     /* Set the Mask Standard ID(11-bit) for IFn Mask Register is used for acceptance filtering*/
00955     CANx->IF0.MASK0 =  0;
00956     CANx->IF0.MASK1 = ((MaskMsg->Id & 0x7FF) << 2) ;
00957   }
00958   else
00959   {
00960     /* extended ID*/
00961     CANx->IF0.ARB0 = (MaskMsg->Id) & 0xFFFF;
00962     CANx->IF0.ARB1 = ((MaskMsg->Id) & 0x1FFF0000) >> 16 | CAN_IF_ARB1_DIR_Msk
00963                    | CAN_IF_ARB1_XTD_Msk | CAN_IF_ARB1_MSGVAL_Msk;
00964     /* Set the Mask Extended ID(29-bit) for IFn Mask Register is used for acceptance filtering*/
00965     CANx->IF0.MASK0 = (MaskMsg->Id) & 0xFFFF;
00966     CANx->IF0.MASK1 = ((MaskMsg->Id) & 0x1FFF0000) >> 16 ;
00967   }
00968 
00969   if(MaskMsg->u8Xtd)
00970     CANx->IF0.MASK1 |= CAN_IF_MASK1_MXTD_Msk;            /* The extended identifier bit (IDE) is used for acceptance filtering */
00971   else
00972     CANx->IF0.MASK1 &= (~CAN_IF_MASK1_MXTD_Msk);  /* The extended identifier bit (IDE) has no effect on the acceptance filtering */
00973 
00974   if(MaskMsg->u8Dir)
00975     CANx->IF0.MASK1 |= CAN_IF_MASK1_MDIR_Msk;     /* The message direction bit (Dir) is used for acceptance filtering */
00976   else
00977     CANx->IF0.MASK1 &= (~CAN_IF_MASK1_MDIR_Msk);  /* The message direction bit (Dir) has no effect on the acceptance filtering */
00978 
00979   CANx->IF0.MCR |= CAN_IF_MCR_UMASK_Msk;                 /* Use Mask (Msk28-0, MXtd, and MDir) for acceptance filtering */
00980 
00981   /* Update the contents needed for transmission*/
00982   CANx->IF0.CMASK = CAN_IF_CMASK_WRRD_Msk      /* Transfer data from the selected Message Buffer Registers to the Message Object addressed */
00983                   | CAN_IF_CMASK_MASK_Msk;     /* Transfer Identifier Mask + MDir + MXtd to Message Object  */
00984 
00985   CANx->IF0.DA0R  = 0;
00986   CANx->IF0.DA1R  = 0;
00987   CANx->IF0.DB0R  = 0;
00988   CANx->IF0.DB1R  = 0;
00989 
00990   /* Set the Message Object in the Message RAM is selected for data transfer */
00991   CANx->IF0.CREQ  = 1 + MsgObj;
00992 
00993   return TRUE;
00994 }
00995 
00996 /* Private functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00997 /** @defgroup CAN_Private_Functions CAN private functions
00998   * @{
00999   */
01000 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01001  * @brief  Check if SmartCard slot is presented.
01002  * @param  CANx: The pointer to CAN module base address.
01003 * @retval Free IF number. IF0_NUM or IF1_NUM or IF_TOTAL_NUM (No IF is free)
01004   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01005 static CANIF_NUMBER_Enum GetFreeIF(HT_CAN_TypeDef  *CANx)
01006 {
01007   if((CANx->IF0.CREQ & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk) == 0)
01008       return IF0_NUM;
01009   else if((CANx->IF1.CREQ  & CAN_IF_CREQ_BUSY_Msk) == 0)
01010       return IF1_NUM;
01011   else
01012       return IF_TOTAL_NUM;
01013 }
01014 /**
01015   * @}
01016   */
01017 
01018 
01019 /**
01020   * @}
01021   */
01022 
01023 /**
01024   * @}
01025   */
01026 
01027 /**
01028   * @}
01029   */
